label: The lost village of Shipden
column5: This village was mentioned in the domesday book
column6: but has since been washed away by coastal erosion.

label: Derwent village
column7: the gateposts of derwent school are visible.

label: Nether Hambleton
column6: The village of Nether Hambleton was completely flooded
column7: but St. Matthew's church was saved (if partially submerged) - when Rutland Water was created by planned flooding.

label: (Old) West End
column5: The village was flooded during the creation of Thruscross Reservoir.

label: Taff Fechan
column5: The church and other village buildings are now under the waters of Ponsticill reservoir

label: Mardale
column6: but if the water level is very low
column7: features of the village (such as an old foot-bridge) become visible.

label: Capel Celyn
column5: The village was flooded in the creation of Llyn Celyn Reservoir.
